page.title: 01STAPELEY & BATHERTON
page.content: The S.W. boundary is the river Weaver.It is a residential suburb of 410 dwellings, no factories and designated as a green belt; only "in-filling" permitted. Most old properties have been enlarged and renovated. There are no public amenities, it being only one and a half miles from Nantwich. Stapeley House since 1960 has been the R.D.C. Offices but in 1977 became N.M.W. Computers plc employing 100. Stapeley Water Gardens and Garden Centre, "The largest in Europe" (adv. on I.T.V) was developed since l975 and employs 50. It attracts thousands of visitors, almost a million annually."Oaklands" wholesale nursery grows conifers and heathers. The farms are small. 9 County Council 40 acre holdings in Batherton and 8 farms of 60 acres. The land is very flat (100' above sea-
